persephone 0.0.1

    Plot

    plot.Rd

    Plot

    plot(x, y, ...)

# S4 method for PersephoneModel,ANY
plot(
  x,
  seasons = 2002,
  cumulative = TRUE,
  save = FALSE,
  dir = getwd(),
  file = "plot.pdf",
  width = 15,
  height = 8
)

# S4 method for PersephoneModelList,ANY
plot(
  x,
  ncol = NULL,
  nrow = NULL,
  save = FALSE,
  dir = getwd(),
  file = "plot.pdf",
  width = 15,
  height = 8,
  ...
)

    Arguments

    x

    an S4 object. The model of interest.

    y

    not used.

    ...

    extra arguments

    seasons

    numeric. The seasons of choice to plot.

    cumulative

    logical. Should the cumulative percentages be plotted?

    save

    logical. Should the plot be saved?

    dir

    character. The directory in which the plot will be saved.

    file

    character. The file name.

    width

    numeric. The width of the plot in inches.

    height

    numeric. The height of the plot in inches.

    ncol

    numeric. Number of rows in the plot layout.

    nrow

    numeric. Number of columns in the plot layout.

    Value

    A plot, created with ggplot2 and ggpubr. The plot is returned wrapped inside invisible().

    Examples

    if (FALSE) {
# Create a Region object
library(cronus)
region <- Region(name = "nebraska", type = "us state",
                 div = c(country = "United States", state = "Nebraska"))

# Create a model
object1 <- new("PersephoneQuasiBin",
             region = region,
            crop = "Corn",
            data = progress_ne$Corn,
            formula = "Stage ~ Time + agdd") # PersephoneModel

# Create another model
object2 <- new("PersephoneCumLink",
            region = region,
            crop = "Soybeans",
            data = progress_ne$Soybeans,
            formula = "Stage ~ Time + agdd + adayl") # PersephoneModel

# Concatenate the models
object <- c(object1, object2) # PersephoneModelList

# Fit
object <- fit(object)

# Plot
plot(object, cumulative = TRUE, seasons = 2002)

# Predict
predict(object, progress_ne)

# Evaluate
object <- crossval(object, maxsam = 100, seed = 1)
plot_metrics(object)

# Summarize
summary(object)

# Report
report(object, name = "example_report", dir = getwd())
}
